articles.headline: Apple Sues Nexus One Maker HTC
articles.snippet: In the lawsuit, Apple said HTC phones running Android violate 20 of its patents, including those relating to the iPhone’s ability to recognize the touch of multiple fingers on its screen at once.
articles.abstract: In the lawsuit, Apple said HTC phones running Android violate 20 of its patents, including those relating to the iPhone’s ability to recognize the touch of multiple fingers on its screen at once.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple has relied on slick applications, and even slicker advertisements, to promote the iPhone and maintain its advantage over rivals like Google in the battle to rule the next generation of smartphones.

articles.headline: Abuse Case Rouses India’s Middle Class
articles.snippet: The case of a girl who was molested by a police official has become a symbol of middle-class rage at a broken system.
articles.abstract: The case of a girl who was molested by a police official has become a symbol of middle-class rage at a broken system.
articles.lead_paragraph: PANCHKULA, India — She was a gifted 14-year-old tennis player who idolized Steffi Graf and hoped to turn pro. He was a senior police official and president of the state lawn tennis club. He lured her to his office with a promise of special coaching that could make her tennis dreams come true, then groped her.

articles.headline: In Tracking Recovery, Jagged Lines
articles.snippet: Whatever you thought at the start of the year about the recovery, you probably need to be more pessimistic today.
articles.abstract: Whatever you thought at the start of the year about the recovery, you probably need to be more pessimistic today.
articles.lead_paragraph: Could the economy be at risk of a double dip?

articles.headline: Viacom and Hulu Part Ways
articles.snippet: The fracture with Viacom will take “The Daily Show With Jon Stewart” and other Comedy Central shows off the video site.
articles.abstract: The fracture with Viacom will take “The Daily Show With Jon Stewart” and other Comedy Central shows off the video site.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the first major fracture between television show owners and the wildly popular Hulu.com, Viacom will remove “The Daily Show With Jon Stewart,” “The Colbert Report” and other Comedy Central programs from the video site next week.

articles.headline: Still With Obama, but Worried
articles.snippet: At the A.F.L.-C.I.O.’s winter meeting, leaders spoke of mobilizing the base to help minimize Republican gains this fall and about how President Obama could do more to help their cause.
articles.abstract: At the A.F.L.-C.I.O.’s winter meeting, leaders spoke of mobilizing the base to help minimize Republican gains this fall and about how President Obama could do more to help their cause.
articles.lead_paragraph: ORLANDO, Fla. — The nation’s union leaders said on Tuesday that they were “appalled” at remarks made by President Obama condoning the mass firing of teachers at a Rhode Island high school.

articles.headline: Britain Grapples With Debt of Greek Proportions
articles.snippet: Without a strong political majority to tackle Britain’s lumbering fiscal problems, the stage could be set for a potential double-dip recession, if not worse.
articles.abstract: Without a strong political majority to tackle Britain’s lumbering fiscal problems, the stage could be set for a potential double-dip recession, if not worse.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — As Greece’s debt troubles batter the euro, Britain has done its utmost to stay above the fray.

articles.headline: ‘Yes’ for Texas Governor Is ‘No’ to Washington
articles.snippet: In the Republican primary, Gov. Rick Perry rode a wave of  anti-Washington sentiment and fended off a challenge from Senator Kay Bailey Hutchison.
articles.abstract: In the Republican primary, Gov. Rick Perry rode a wave of  anti-Washington sentiment and fended off a challenge from Senator Kay Bailey Hutchison.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Senator Kay Bailey Hutchison had all the advantages a year ago when she laid her plans to run for governor: a high popularity rating, a party shaken by President Obama’s victory, a big bankroll and, most important, the backing of influential Republicans, who felt the incumbent governor, Rick Perry, was too divisive and too conservative.
articles.byline: By James C. McKinley Jr. and Clifford Krauss
